snippet: Superintendents are arguing that student tests imported from Utah were flawed and should not be used to give schools A-to-F grades.
abstract: Florida state school superintendents, joined by parents and teachers, protest state's plans to partially use Common Core test results they claim are flawed; tests used were based on Utah curriculum and marred by technical glitches; group urges state not to use scores punitively, but as comparative baseline for assessing next year's learning gains.
lead_paragraph: Superintendents are arguing that student tests imported from Utah were flawed and should not be used to give schools A-to-F grades.

headline.print_headline: Superintendents in Florida Say Tests Failed State’s Schools, not Vice Versa
headline.main: Superintendents in Florida Say Tests Failed State’s Schools, Not Vice Versa
